Description: The Living Planet Index for the North America IPBES region: 1970 to 2020. The bold line shows the index values and the shaded areas represent the statistical certainty surrounding the trend (95%). The index represents 2,449 populations of 935 freshwater and terrestrial species. All indices are weighted by species richness, giving species-rich taxonomic groups in terrestrial and freshwater systems more weight than groups with fewer species. Index values are smoothed using a 3-year running average but keeping the first and final index values fixed.
